cyclone.name: JOSE
cyclone.current_location: about 1330 miles east of the Lesser Antilles
cyclone.trajectory: moving generally west to west-northwest and forecast to approach the northern Leeward Islands and pass near or north of Puerto Rico late this weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Leeward Islands (Antigua/Barbuda area) â€“ may pass just north of Puerto Rico rather than making landfall

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands, potentially Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands late weekend
weather_observation.wind: Low (7%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds late Sunday; breezy conditions possible
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected with current forecast track
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring periods of heavy showers late Sunday into Monday, but widespread 4-inch totals are unlikely unless the track shifts closer
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increasing swells and rough seas beginning this weekend could disrupt port and vessel operations
